Binary Machine¶

Author: Santiago Passos & Alejandro Rojas

class Binary_machine.Binary_machine(mantissa_len=8, exponent_bits=4)[source]¶

Class to handle machine number representation, this is, convert from a real number to a machine number and vice versa.

mantissa_len¶

The number of bits that the mantissa can store.

Type

int

exponent_bits¶

The number of bits to represent the exponent in base 2.

Type

int

dec_to_bin(dec_num)[source]¶

Get the binary representation of the integer an decimal part of a number.

Parameters

dec_num (numeric) – Number to get integer and decimal part from.

Returns

integer part, decimal part

Return type

tuple

dec_to_machine(num)[source]¶

Given a decimal number in base 10 it returns it representation as machine number using the exponent mantissa standard.

Parameters

num (numeric) – Real number that will be represented as machine number.

Returns

The machine representation of the given number.

Return type

str

greatest_number()[source]¶

Returns the greatest number that the machine can store.

Parameters

None –

Returns

The greatest number that the machine can store.

Return type

int

machine_epsilon()[source]¶

Returns the machine epsilon. Smallest number that can sum to 1.

Parameters

None –

Returns

The machine epsilon.

Return type

numeric

machine_to_dec(machine_number)[source]¶

Given a machine number it returns it representation in base 10.

Parameters

num (numeric) – Machine number that will be represented as real number.

Returns

The decimal representation of the given number.

Return type

str

operate_two_decimals(num1, num2, fun)[source]¶

Given 2 decimal numbers and a binary arithmetic function returns the result of the function.

Parameters

  • num1 (numeric) – The first parameter for the binary function.

  • num2 (numeric) – The second parameter for the binary function.

  • fun (binary function) – Binary function to be applied (sum, substract, times).

Returns

The result of the function in machine number.

Return type

str

operate_two_machine_numbers(num1, num2, fun)[source]¶

Given 2 decimal numbers in machine representation and a binary arithmetic function returns the result of the function.

Parameters

  • num1 (str) – The first parameter for the binary function as machine number.

  • num2 (str) – The second parameter for the binary function as machine number.

  • fun (binary function) – Binary function to be applied (sum, substract, times).

Returns

The result of the function in machine number.

Return type

str

Binary_machine.base_k_to_dec(num, base)[source]¶

Get the representation in base 10 of an decimal number (0.d1d2d3…) in base k.

Parameters

  • num (int) – The decimal number without the 0. For instance if you want to convert 0.1110 in base 2, you should pass 1110

  • base (int) – The base that the number is in.

Returns

The representation of the number in base 10.

Return type

numeric

Binary_machine.base_k_to_int(num, base)[source]¶

Get the representation in base 10 of an integer in base k.

Parameters

  • num (int) – The integer number in the given base.

  • base (int) – The base that the number is in.

Returns

The representation of the number in base 10.

Return type

numeric

Binary_machine.dec_to_base_k(dec, base, mantissa_len=40)[source]¶

Get the representation in base k of an decimal number (0.d1d2d3..) in base 10.

Parameters

  • num (int) – Integer to be converted to base k. Note that if you want to convert, for example, 0.234 you should pass it as 234.

  • base (int) – The base that will be used in the conversion.

Returns

The representation in base k of the given number.

Return type

str

Binary_machine.int_to_base_k(num, base)[source]¶

Get the representation in base k of an integer in base 10.

Parameters

  • num (int) – Integer to be converted to base k.

  • base (int) – The base that will be used in the conversion.

Returns

The representation in base k of the given number.

Return type

str

Binary_machine.real_to_base_k(num, k)[source]¶

Convert a real number to its representation in base k.

Parameters

  • num (numeric) – A real number.

  • base (int) – The base that will be used in the conversion.

Returns

The representation of the number in base k.

Return type

str
